name: Modern Languages
financialSupport: There is a Â£10,000 tax free bursary available to study Secondary MFL PGCE. See https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-your-training?gclid=CjwKCAjw55-HBhAHEiwARMCszqQTbE1ZPBDTwgLngWnXTvZrwJxEyPr24a-M9Wyetn2BO1JmQxTQVRoC744QAvD_BwE&gclsrc=aw.ds for further details
aboutCourse: In this secondary MFL PGCE, trainees will specialise in teaching at least 1 language up to A level (KS3-KS5). You will also have opportunities to observe other languages taught and to upskill in these subjects.
interviewProcess: In order to secure a place, candidates will prepare and deliver a 25 minute teaching episode to 6 year 7 students on their subject area, followed by a 30 minute panel interview with representatives from Cleeve School and the University of Gloucestershire
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
There are 2 placements

Placement 1: September - December (Mon-Thurs)
Placement 2: January - June (Mon - Thurs)

Our partner secondary schools all teach from year 7 and during the academic year, you will have opportunity to teach up to Key Stage 5

Training sessions will be held each Friday at Cleeve Training Hub
personalQualities: We are looking to appoint trainees who are passionate about languages and the importance of language learning for all.  We want to work with trainees who have high aspirations for the young people they work with and a desire for them to achieve.
